THIS MODIFICATION IS BEING ISSUED TO CLOSE OUT THE PORTS OF INDIANA JEFFERSONVILLE PROJECT TITLED 2015 TIGER VII TRUCK TO RAIL AND RAIL TO WATER IMPROVEMENTS THE PROJECT WAS AWARDED UNDER GRANT AGREEMENT DTMA91G1600003A THE MARITIME ADMINISTRATION RECEIVED THE PORTS OF INDIANA JEFFERSONVILLE COMPLETION OF PROJECT AND ACCEPTANCE LETTER DATED 11012022 CERTIFYING THAT THE PROJECTS TERMS AND CONDITIONS SCOPE OF WORK AND ASSURANCE THAT ALL REQUIRED FUNDING HAS BEEN COMMITTED AND RECEIVED WITHIN THE TIMELINE FOR COMPLETION OF THE PROJECT AS DEFINED IN THE GRANT AGREEMENT

AWARD PURPOSE TO COMPARE THE UNDERWATER NOISE GENERATED BY TWO FERRIES AN EXISTING FERRY WITH CONVENTIONAL DIESEL GEARED PROPULSION AND A NEW VESSEL WITH BATTERY ELECTRIC PROPULSION. THESE VESSELS ARE TO BE MEASURED WHILE THE VESSELS ARE IN SERVICE WITH EQUIVALENT OPERATING CONDITIONS TO ALLOW DIRECT COMPARISONS OF URN FROM THE VESSELS. THE DATA COLLECTED IN THIS STUDY WILL BE COMPARED WITH PERTINENT COMMERCIAL STANDARDS AND WILL BE USED TO IDENTIFY NOISE REDUCTIONS THAT MAY BE EXPECTED ON FUTURE VESSELS WHEN A BATTERY ELECTRIC PROPULSION SYSTEM IS USED. THE STUDY WILL CONTRIBUTE TO BROADER INTERNATIONAL DISCUSSIONS REGARDING VESSEL URN AND INFORM VESSEL OWNERS AND OPERATORS OF ANY POTENTIAL NOISE REDUCTIONS THAT COULD BE REALIZED THROUGH CHANGES TO EXISTING OR NEW BUILD ENGINES AND/OR POWER SOURCES.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDERWATER NOISE STUDY PROJECT.  DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES A DETAILED REPORT OF ALL FINDINGS.  INTENDED BENEFICIARY MARAD AND NOISE CONTROL ENGINEERING LLC NCE.  SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES NOT APPLICABLE.

AWARD PURPOSE THIS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF AND ACCESS TO SURFACE MARINE OBSERVATIONS IN ALASKA WATERS.  ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED MARINE EXCHANGE OF ALASKA MXAK WILL INSTALL WEATHER STATIONS ON SIX ALASKA MARINE HIGHWAY VESSELS.  DELIVERABLES EXPECTED OUTCOMES   THE WEATHER STATIONS WILL BE CONNECTED TO THE VESSELS EXISTING AUTOMATIC IDENTIFICATION SYSTEM IS TO SEND WEATHER DATA AUTOMATICALLY TO THE MXAK SERVER.  INTENDED BENEFICIARY MXAK AND MARAD. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  NONE.

THIS AGREEMENT SETS FORTH THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS FOR THE AWARD OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO ABS TO PROVIDE THE PROFILE OF COMMERCIAL HARBOR CRAFT CHC INDUSTRY IN CALIFORNIA INCLUDING PORT BUNKERING INFRASTRUCTURE, EVALUATE ALTERNATIVE FUELS AND POWER OPTIONS FOR CHC AND DESCRIBE THE POTENTIAL FOR THESE FUELS AND POWER OPTIONS TO MEET DOMESTIC ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATIONS. THE  FINAL PRODUCT REPORT COULD BE USED AS BASELINE REFERENCE REGARDING RECOMMENDATIONS FOR FUTURE DEMONSTRATION OR PILOT PROGRAMS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES THE NECESSARY FOUNDATION FOR THE META PROGRAM TO PARTNER WITH PASHA STEVEDORING AND TERMINALS L.P. (PST) IN ORDER TO GATHER FEASIBILITY AND OPERATIONAL DATA FOR A MICROGRID DEMONSTRATION/PILOT PROJECT THAT USE NON-CONVENTIONAL OR ALTERNATIVE ENERGY SOURCES TO DECREASE AIR EMISSIONS FROM VESSEL/PORT OPERATIONS. THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT, MARAD AND RECIPIENT WILL PARTNER TO CARRY OUT THIS DEMONSTRATION PROJECT THAT SUPPORT MARINE TRANSPORTATION ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES.

THE PURPOSE FOR THIS MODIFICATION IS TO ADD ADDITIONAL FUNDING TO ALLOW CASCO BAY LINES TO CONTINUE WORKING ON THE HYBRID FERRY DEMONSTRATION PROJECT DUE TO PANDEMIC SUPPLY COST INCREASE.

THIS NO COST EXTENSION WILL FACILITATE THE EVALUATION OF COOLING CAPACITY USING SEA WATER AND EXHAUST GAS AS THE DRIVING THERMAL INPUTS. CURRENT THE 2022 CRUISE WILL USE SEAWATER AND JACKET WATER. A FINAL REPORT AFTER EACH CRUISE WILL BE PROVIDED. THE EVALUATION OF THESE TWO METHODS WOULD VERIFY APPLICABILITY TO BOTH DIESEL AND TURBINE SHIPBOARD  GENERATORS.
